dict.string:
Hello Guillermo,


I sincerely apologize for the delay in response, we are experiencing higher than normal ticket volume. I am very sorry to hear you continue to experience issues when sending and receiving from Twilio numbers.


After further investigation, it appears that Twilio rolled out loop detection system on June 8th, 2016 to catch messages that may be caught in a loop and prevent accounts being stuck in a looping behavior. We have many incidents in the past where customers accidentally created a looping behavior when sending to and from Twilio numbers accruing high costs on their account. Twilio will like to prevent this for our customers to avoid situations like one I have mentioned above. There is also another issue with your Message Request URL for (213) 784-9723: `https://sandboxshl.testprod-we1.xcade.net/sms/twilio` (explained below).


There are two issues going on:


(1) It looks like our detection system caught the recent messages you attempted to send to 12137849723 from +16464801892. Moving forward, anytime you attempt to deliver "from" and "to" a Twilio number with the default Demo URL and message: "Thanks for the message. Configure your number's SMS URL to change this message.Reply HELP for help.Reply STOP to unsubscribe.Msg&Data rates may apply", these messages will no longer be delivered. This is to prevent looping between two Twilio numbers. If you will like to continue sending to and from Twilio numbers, please configure a new Message Request URL that's not the Twilio Demo URL.


(2) The second issue is that Message Request URL: `https://sandboxshl.testprod-we1.xcade.net/sms/twilio`, is throwing a "Certificate Invalid- 11237" error. Twilio received this error "Certificate exception: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target" when attempting to make a request URL to send outbound responses. Please ensure that the certificate you are using is not self-signed and it is approved by Mozilla. For more information, please see below:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/errors/11237


https://www.twilio.com/console/sms/logs/SMaad520f2d4d32c06d5a784714d7bafa7


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,


Josephine

Hello Guillermo,
I sincerely apologize for the delay in response, we are experiencing higher than normal ticket volume. I am very sorry to hear you continue to experience issues when sending and receiving from Twilio numbers.
After further investigation, it appears that Twilio rolled out loop detection system on June 8th, 2016 to catch messages that may be caught in a loop and prevent accounts being stuck in a looping behavior. We have many incidents in the past where customers accidentally created a looping behavior when sending to and from Twilio numbers accruing high costs on their account. Twilio will like to prevent this for our customers to avoid situations like one I have mentioned above. There is also another issue with your Message Request URL for (213) 784-9723: `https://sandboxshl.testprod-we1.xcade.net/sms/twilio` (explained below).
There are two issues going on:
(1) It looks like our detection system caught the recent messages you attempted to send to 12137849723 from +16464801892. Moving forward, anytime you attempt to deliver "from" and "to" a Twilio number with the default Demo URL and message: "Thanks for the message. Configure your number's SMS URL to change this message.Reply HELP for help.Reply STOP to unsubscribe.Msg&Data rates may apply", these messages will no longer be delivered. This is to prevent looping between two Twilio numbers. If you will like to continue sending to and from Twilio numbers, please configure a new Message Request URL that's not the Twilio Demo URL.
(2) The second issue is that Message Request URL: `https://sandboxshl.testprod-we1.xcade.net/sms/twilio`, is throwing a "Certificate Invalid- 11237" error. Twilio received this error "Certificate exception: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target" when attempting to make a request URL to send outbound responses. Please ensure that the certificate you are using is not self-signed and it is approved by Mozilla. For more information, please see below:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/errors/11237
https://www.twilio.com/console/sms/logs/SMaad520f2d4d32c06d5a784714d7bafa7
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
Josephine
